pros: Employees are very well treated. Good base pay for bartending and ushering. A relaxing and easy place to work. Good parties with free booze.
cons: management micro manages every detail of your job. You are not encouraged to think for yourself.

pros:
Management was kind, fair and approachable. 
Most co-workers were nice and fun to work with.
You can watch the operas/ballets.
Everything was very well organized.
If you are an artist, you are working with people who like the arts, but keep in mind, it's not a creative job.
cons:
Some co-workers were pretty uptight and strict with rules...
You kind of have to "put on" a certain presentation when patrons are nearby. So that can be exhausting.

pros:
Working for the Canadian Opera Company as an "Employee".  They offer a great base plus bonus structure for a part time position.  As a Professional Fundraiser, I did very well here and owe much thanks to Mr. Paradiso for his instruction. 
Working for the COC allowed me to volunteer in other areas of the House. Working for the COC allowed me to contribute hours to CFRE designation. The Staff meetings included words of wisdom from Mr. Neef himself. Small work team, dedicated environment. It is a great place to learn about the Opera and many of those that work in there do for a long time because of the passion for the art. As a person with neurological differences, this was my happy space and enjoyed sharing my special interest with patrons and renewing their interest in Opera. 
It is 2019 and my passion for the COC remains. Mr. Neef did a wonderful job.
cons:
Strong personalities, drama and tears - all that you expect from an Opera. 
Work - Life balance was difficult. When you have a core team producing millions these employees should be on salary with commission and benefits. There were six of us who brought significant amounts and were loyal to the position. The only complaints were about having to get two jobs to support coming to work for the Opera. We were more than deserving of respect.  Our Manager was tough, but I found it necessary for the work we do. No room to further own Opera Career or down time to be a "Super" because of the Hours. Leads are paper so not eco friendly and this was difficult for some as the paper waste was great.
A major donor (couple) and underwriter wanted to sponsor my career where returning to England. They gave instructions to a trusted individual in management who was to set me up with this gift - then ghosted me! It was a once in a lifetime opportunity and missed. As a result, I lost faith in the Company because some people saw my youth and special needs as undeserving which is ironic because Music does not discriminate: Opera brings life to people like me.
